subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight
author: bruce halliday

Well steve, 
 
you need to remember I was around when the halloween incide=
nt took place
I just did not want the research to take another blow. But wh=
at you are planning I think 
is a good thing to offer new individuals the o=
pportunity to get involved.
 
Not that you owe me or anyone an explination =
but I thank you for that one.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.comFrom: urkel23@...: Sun, 3 Feb 2008 18:26:54 +0000Subject: [=
EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight




I appreciate the concern, however i have=
 learned from the past experience. I was going to go and do a brief backgro=
und on my limited time so far in ITC and box research and maybe turn the di=
fferent devices on for those to hear how each one sounds. I probably wasn't=
 going to ask questions due to the halloween event when i received no spiri=
tual contacts, but that wasn't a meeting either where i could explain what =
i was doing. I also am going to bring the 4 spare hacked 470 radios i have =
to offer to potential future researchers. Nothing is etched in stone yet wi=
th me going, i have to contact them first and see if that's what they want.=
 I was supposed to go in November, but declined because i wasn't ready to d=
isplay yet. Now, there is so many different radios out there that i can off=
er the idea for those who wish to approach this research with an open mind.=
-Steve H.--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday <paranormalinvestig=
ating@...> wrote:>> > Steve,> > I listened to the file, It could have said =
what is labeled.> It was kinda rough and I don't think anyone but an experi=
enced> researcher used to listening to Frank's box would hear anything> fro=
m the random mode especially.> > I think you may have gotten caught up in t=
he moment, I know those group sessions can get exciting.> My advice would b=
e to hold off on any public display sessions until we refine the communivat=
ion to > where the average listener is capable of hearing a response. Don't=
 forget what happened on halloween in staten Island.> Or what happened to t=
hose knuckle heads at pulse radio.> > I think it would be detrimental to th=
e research not to go somewhere and have a group of people hear nothing but =
what > they discern as noise. for the simple reason that they are not equip=
ed to hear the actual responses.> > Just my opinion as afriend and fellow r=
esearcher. also I believe our friend Frank believes that the box was not me=
ant > for field work and does not perform to the best of it's ability in a =
public situation.> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: urkel23@.=
..: Sat, 2 Feb 2008 22:11:07 -0500Subject: [EVP-ITC] File from tonight> > >=
 > > > > I have been having weird sessions with Frank's Box #27, but in a g=
ood way. They told me to change the antenna, which it did and the random st=
arted working and never has on this box. They told me tonight to put the ol=
d antenna back on and the sessions keep getting better and better. I dragge=
d Juli and Joel in on what i believed and felt was going to be a great box =
session and here is a file only a couple minutes in to our hour long sessio=
n. This is a bit rough sounding, but hearing it live is pretty clear and yo=
u can hear me respond and than Joel agrees that he heard it too. My session=
s are pretty incredible since the random mode started working on the FB#27 =
and i feel the random is the best thing out there...hands down. I have done=
 Sessions on the internet through Skype all week and i feel the energy betw=
een Juli and I are really bringing them through clearly. I only use FB#27 n=
ow in random mode and it is the best feature on any box, between the white =
noise, echo and random there is no competetion up to this point. The hacks =
are good, but nothing is better than an original frank's box. Our friends o=
n the other side told me that they fixed the random mode to go and teach ot=
hers and i am going to a meeting on wednesday to demonstrate the different =
boxes and our friend made a promise to come though if i go....so we will se=
e.> > Here is one of the files i got so far.> > -Steve H.> > > Who's never =
won? Biggest Grammy Award surprises of all time on AOL Music.> > > > > > > =

top of the charts! Play the word scramble challenge with star power.> http:=
